item.title: Bulletin updated at 13:02 HKT 19/12/2021
item.description:
At 1 p.m. at the Hong Kong Observatory :
Air temperature : 19 degrees Celsius
Relative Humidity : 42 per cent
During the past hour the mean UV Index recorded at King's Park : 3
Intensity of UV radiation : moderate

The northeast monsoon continues to affect Hong Kong today (19 December). Besides, Tropical Cyclone Rai over the South China Sea will maintain a distance of more than 800 kilometres from Hong Kong today. According to the present forecast track, Rai will take a northerly track today, moving across the central part of the South China Sea and weakening gradually. It will come within 800 kilometres of Hong Kong tomorrow (20 December), edging gradually towards the coast of Guangdong. Depending on the intensity and track of Rai, the Observatory will consider the necessity of issuing a tropical cyclone warning signal during the day tomorrow. Rain bands associated with Rai is expected to bring rainy weather to the northern part of the South China Sea and the coast of Guangdong in the next couple of days. The Observatory will closely monitor its development. Members of the public should take note of changes in weather early to midweek this week.

Please be reminded that:
The Fire Danger Warning is Red and the fire risk is extreme.
